title: Around the Districts : Cloonacool , Enniscrone - Kilglass and Skreen - Dromard
body_text:
Around the Districts: Cloonacool, Enniscrone-Kilglass and Skreen-Dromard
Cloonacool
Sheep Festival
All roads lead to Cloonacool this weekend when we host our annual Sheep Festival. The festival has built slowly since it was first held in 2019 to a place where it is now firmly established as one of the region’s most attractive farming and social events.
Kieran Quinn: The festival opens on Thursday 18th September with a show featuring Sligo’s own Kieran Quinn. Quinn is a firm favourite after he endeared himself to local audiences last year. His visit then gave rise to new song about the festival itself and this year he has promised a few surprises as well. 9pm start.
Music Bingo: Friday 19th sees the return of Music Bingo. This event is great craic and one not to be missed with fun and games and prizes galore. This will all be accompanied with a rich helping of music from the 1980s. 9pm start
Tractor Run and Dancing: Saturday 20th at 2pm will see the festival set a World Record by hosting the largest Kiddies Tractor Run ever staged. This event is also a charity fundraiser for Féileacáin. Later that night, the festival dance will take place in the capable hands of up-and-coming country star, Gavin Cribbin (on stage at 10pm)
Open Day: Sunday 21st is Show Day with the traditional sheep and dog shows taking place. Sunday will also feature fun for all the family and Sunday night will be one last final chance to enjoy the festival in the company of Colin Kenny, for more dancing and fun. Grounds open at 12pm.
Sheep and Dog Shows: Sunday 21st sees Cloonacool hosts two great shows; a sheep show, held in memory of the people who maintained a great sheep farming tradition in Cloonacool over the decades and a dog show, held in memory of a great local dog lover, the late Kathy Kelly. These shows attract entries from all over the West of Ireland and are now among the most prestigious in the calendar. Shows start at 1.30pm.
Festival Draw Tickets
Tickets for the annual joint Cloonacool Sheep Festival and Community Centre draw are now on sale locally. They are available from the Mill Community Café and at events during the festival.
The sale of these tickets allows the organising committee to run a free event when festival Sunday comes around. Proceeds help to cover essential set-up and insurance costs. Top prizes on offer amounting to €2,000. Please support.
Notes
Please submit notes for inclusion to cloonacoolnotes@gmail.com by 6pm on Thursday
Enniscrone-Kilglass
Your news
Would you or your family, community group, school, etc. wish to highlight your activities/achievements, if so, please send your news and pictures to the West Sligo Family Resource Centre before 12 noon on Friday or call 096/37444 E-Mail enniscronetourism3@gmail.com
West Sligo Family Resource Centre
Noel Feeney’s collage/art workshop for Adults on Monday 22nd September from 1–3pm Fun Dance class with Carmel is back starting Friday 19th September from 11–12pm..cost €8 per class. Beginners Pilates with Caroline starting Monday morning 29th September from 11–12 pm... cost €50 for 6 weeks. Payable on the first day. Breathwork with Aisling on Thursday 25th September at 7.30pm...cost €5
Pole walking starting Tuesday 23rd September from 11–12 midday...cost €20 for 5-week block. Free digital skills/beginner computer classes every Wednesday from 10–1pm. Free Chair based Exercise classes for older adults starting Thursday September 18th at 12–1 midday. For further information E-mail events@westsligofrc.ie or call 096-37444.
Killeenduff NS
Clothing Fundraiser: Killeenduff National School (Eircode: F26 KX78) is collecting used clothes and textiles. Please drop off donations in black bags during school hours before 19th September.
Bewleys Coffee Morning: Parents, Guardians, Grannies, Grandads and members of the community are welcome to the Bewleys Coffee Morning in Killeenduff NS, Easkey on Friday 26th September between 10.15am to 11.15am
Home baking encouraged. All donations on the day to to North West Hospice in Sligo.
Condolences
Our sincere condolences to the family and friends of the late Desmond (Des) Kenny of Belfast and formerly of Carrenrod, Easkey, unexpectedly.
Beloved husband of Pari, and devoted father to Daisy, Pearse, Daphne, Delphine. Des will be sadly missed by his wife and family, his parents Bernie Michael and Ann, his brothers Enda and David, and his sister Imelda. May his gentle soul Rest In Peace.
Blotto
Kilglass Enniscrone United Football Club/ Combined Enniscrone Football Clubs Blotto. Play Online: https://www.lottoraiser.ie/EnniscroneCFC/
Results 7th September. Blotto Jackpot €7,000. No Jackpot Winner. No’s drawn: 8, 32, 43. €25 winners: Mary Regan; Michael Gordon; E. Mary Boland; Abigail, Aidan & Miah Foley. The Jackpot for the next draw on 14th Septemberin the McNulty’s Bar will be €7,200.
West Sligo Athletics Club
We at West Sligo Athletics Club are thrilled to organise the annual Ó Dubhda Challenge in beautiful Enniscrone, Co. Sligo! Whether you’re aiming for the 10K, Half Marathon, or 20-Mile run, there’s a distance for everyone. Race Day: Sunday, 5th October. Location: Enniscrone, Sligo. Take in breathtaking views along the Wild Atlantic Way and enjoy the charm of Enniscrone. W
e’re proudly sponsored by Anam Pharmacy, supporting our community and this incredible event. Their ongoing commitment to community health and wellbeing plays a vital role in bringing this event to life. Thanks to Anam Pharmacy’s incredible support, we’re able to host a celebration of fitness, community spirit, and local pride right here in West Sligo. Registration is OPEN now! Don’t miss your chance to take part in one of West Sligo’s most scenic and exhilarating races.
Thank you to our digital sponsor, U Marketing Labs, for supporting the West Sligo Athletics Club and this year’s O’Dubhda Challenge.
Enniscrone Men’s Shed
The Shed Committee would like to sincerely thank our local Councillor Joe Queenan for his generous donation of 100 euros. Your support is greatly appreciated and will contribute to the ongoing work and activities of the Shed for the benefit of our community.
Kilglass Enniscrone United FC
Senior ladies and over 18’s girls, training Monday’s 7-8pm at Michae McGowan Park F26FR90, new members are always welcome. Come along and join our Walking Soccer each Wednesay 7.30pm-8.30pm non-contact, open to men and women, all welcome, 18+ Michael McGowan Park, no experience necessary.
Castleconnor Blotto
There was no winner of last week’s jackpot of €13,500 or no match 3 winner. Congratulations to Imelda Maguire who was the winner of our lucky dip. Next week’s jackpot is now an amazing €13,600. Match 3 is €200.
Castleconnor Community Centre
Men on the move is back in Castleconnor Community Centre on Tuesday September 16th for 6 weeks. Registration 8.15pm, Tuesday’s 8.30-9.30, all enquiries to Bernie Finlay on 087 6164788.
Skreen-Dromard
September Social Dance
The second September Dance in the Skreen Dromard Community Centre will take place on Saturday 27th with Music by Ferryman. Dancing commences at 9pm and everyone welcome.
An Evening of Music
An Evening Concert of Country and Gospel Music with Jimmy Buckley will take place in St. Adamnan’s Church Skreen on Sunday November 23rd. Tickets cost €25 and are now on sale from Audrie Kee on 086-6069063 or from Helen Kilgallen on 087-6806905. Doors open at 4pm. The Concert starts at 5pm. All proceeds in aid of the Skreen Dromard Community Centre.
Tractor Run
A Tractor Run will take place on Sunday September 28th 2025 from the Skreen Dromard Community Centre. Registration is at 1.pm and Tractors depart at 2pm. Entry fee €20 per tractor. Refreshments will be served afterwards.
All Proceeds in aid of The Alzheimer Society of Ireland. For any enquiry or further information please contact James on 085 159 5305
Retirement Function
A Mass of Thanksgiving and Retirement Function to mark the retirement of Martin Mulligan as Principal of High Park National School will take place in St. Adamnan’s Church Skreen on Friday November 7th at 7pm.
The Mass will be followed by refreshments served in the Skreen Dromard Community Centre. Anyone who would like to be involved in the preparations please contact Annette on 087-6808522.
Skreen Garda Barracks
Skreen Barracks is now manned every Tuesday, with the opening hours of 10am to 1pm.
Skreen Dromard Active Retirement
The Skreen Dromard Community Care Active Retirement Group have resumed their Chair Yoga with Elle in the Skreen Health Centre from Wednesday September 3rd from 11am to 12 noon and will continue each Wednesday. These are gentle chair based exercises therefore suitable for all abilities.
Dementia Social Inclusive Club
The Club meet every second Wednesday in the Skreen Dromard Community Centre from 2.30pm to 4.30pm with the next meeting on Wednesday, September 24th and every two weeks from then.
The Club now wishes to expand and engage the wider community in the following areas: Dromore West Easkey Enniscrone Ballina Ballisodare, Collooney and Coolaney. If you live in any of these areas you are very welcome to come along on any of the bi-monthly Wednesdays at the Skreen Dromard Community Centre where you can enjoy a cup of tea and chat. For further details or enquiries ring Erin Lynch on 087-3972583.
Walking Group
The Walking Group continue their walks every Monday at 11am. For further details contact Anne Marie on 087-7566514 or Ciara on 087-4183759.
Easkey Meals on Wheels
The Easkey Meals on Wheels Service is available in this area from the Easkey Community Centre. For further info contact (096) 49818.
Beltra Country Market
Beltra Country Market will move to the Skreen Dromard Community Centre from Saturday September 13th for the duration of the Beltra Hall Roof renovations. The market will be open from 10:00- 12:00 with lots of home baking, garden produce and beautifully handcrafted gifts and cards for all occasions. The Market looks forward to welcoming customers to this new venue where you are assured of a very warm welcome. Please support your local market.
Parent and Toddler Group
The Parent and Toddler Group will meet every Thursday in the Skreen Dromard Community Centre from 10.30am to 11.30am. Connect, enjoy a cuppa and have fun with your little one. €3 per family for ages 0 to 36 months
Friends of Carmel
Friends of Carmel at Holy Hill Hermitage are holding a Day Retreat on Saturday October 11th from 10am to 4pm. To book a place please Email: friendsofcarmelhh@gmail.com. Everyone welcome. Donations appreciated.
Bereavement Support Group
The weekly Bereavement Support Group have resumed at Knock Shrine since Wednesday September 10th at 11am in the Family Centre. No appointment needed and all welocme
Templeboy Foróige Club
Templeboy Foróige Club is now recruiting new adult volunteers for the coming Club year. By sharing time and experience volunteers can help young people build confidence, learn new things and get involved in their Community. If you can lend some of your time on a Friday evening, please contact Jason on 086-1084116.
Tireragh CCÉ
Tireragh CCÉ held a Registration and Music Session on Saturday September 13th from 11am to 1pm in Dromore West Community Centre. Classes in various instruments for persons 6 years and upwards. Registration fee is €6 per child and €12 per adult or €20 per family. All welcome to join.
Speech and Drama
The Maye School of Speech & Drama has resumed from Tuesday September 16th in the Skreen Dromard Community Centre. Limited places available . Contact Jacinta on 087-2210845
